figureCitation.captionText: FIGURE 1. Scoloplos cylindrifer, A–F, H, I: stereomicroscope, methylene blue staining; G, J. AM W.25967: compound microscope. A. AM W.43432, general view; B. AM W.40555, anterior part, dorso-lateral view; C. AM W.25967, anterior part, lateral view; D. AM W.17586, thorax-abdomen transition, lateral view; E. AM W.17586, anterior end, ventro-lateral view; F. AM W.17586, abdomen, anterior part, dorsal view; G. parapodium of chaetiger 2; H. AM W.40555, abdomen, posterior part; I. AM W.17586, posterior end with pygidium; J. Posterior thoracic parapodium. a, acicula; br, branchia; cc, crenulated capillaries; ne, neuropodium; no, notopodium; u, uncini.

09.03.1992
, depth 8.5 m, coll. S.J. Keable ,
Diopatra
tubes at base of jetty pilings, AM W.25967, 2 specimens ; Newcastle, West Basin Berth 2, 32°55’S , 151°46’ E ,

September 1908

09.10.1984
, coll. P.A. Hutchings , S.J. Keable, J. van der Velde, AM W.201399, 1 specimen . Commonwealth Territory : Jervis Bay , Murrays Beach, 35°07’30”S , 150°45’30”E , 1972, coll. NSW State Fisheries, AM W.17586, 1 specimen (previously identified as
S. novaehollandiae

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Scoloplos cylindrifer
, A–F, H, I: stereomicroscope, methylene blue staining; G, J. AM W.25967: compound microscope. A. AM W.43432, general view; B. AM W.40555, anterior part, dorso-lateral view; C. AM W.25967, anterior part, lateral view; D. AM W.17586, thorax-abdomen transition, lateral view; E. AM W.17586, anterior end, ventro-lateral view; F. AM W.17586, abdomen, anterior part, dorsal view; G. parapodium of chaetiger 2; H. AM W.40555, abdomen, posterior part; I. AM W.17586, posterior end with pygidium; J. Posterior thoracic parapodium. a, acicula; br, branchia; cc, crenulated capillaries; ne, neuropodium; no, notopodium; u, uncini.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution . Australia , Western Australia , South Australia , Victoria , Tasmania , New South Wales , New Zealand .
Habitat. Intertidal and upper subtidal, seagrass, algae, polychaete tubes, mixed sediments.

Remarks . For the detailed history of the species see Blake (2017 , pp. 51–52). In addition, Blake (2017) moved
Scoloplos cylindrifer
to the genus
Leodamas
, group B. The specimens examined in the present study are in agreement with the descriptions by Hartman (1957), Day (1975) , and Hartmann-Schröder (1981) .
